Row.Text: The ideals of the enlightened age have finally reached our court. As a great defender of absolutism, these ideals which preach liberty and popular sovereignty threaten our very power. But perhaps it need not be this way. Perhaps within these ideals lies the assertion of an enlightened absolutism, and so perhaps these ideals should instead be embraced and used to re-affirm our noble authority.[NEWLINE]

Following his death some years earlier, General Carl von Clausewitz's most important work, 'Vom Kriege,' has finally been compiled by his widow. It is a remarkable exposition on the art of war, and details many of the strategies employed by some of history's greatest commanders. We are most fortunate that our nation should have given birth to such a brilliant mind.[NEWLINE]
We must read it at once!
